author: haidouks
body:
# Steps to reproduce
In 7.0.0-preview.6-ubuntu-bionic, run the following command.

```
$json = @"
["CANSIN"]
"@
$list = [System.Collections.ArrayList]($json | ConvertFrom-Json)

```

# Expected behavior
Command should not throw exception.

```

```

# Actual behavior
Throws conversion exception

```
InvalidArgument: Cannot convert the "CANSIN" value of type "System.String" to type "System.Collections.ArrayList".

```

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-preview.6
PSEdition                      Core

WSManStackVersion              3.0

```

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
It is indirectly related to #11077, but there's a more immediate issue:

`ConvertFrom-Json`'s default output behavior has changed after the discussion in #3424: it now _enumerates_ an array by default, so as to be consistent with how cmdlets are generally expected to output _multiple_ objects.

You now need `-NoEnumerate`  to prevent this enumeration:

```powershell
PS> ('[ "one "]' | ConvertFrom-Json -NoEnumerate).GetType().Name
Object[]  # array
```

You can then cast the above to `[System.Collections.ArrayList]`.

The original command failed, because you cannot cast a _scalar_ as an array list, which is somewhat unexpected, given that it works with both `System.Array` and  `System.Collections.Generic.List<T>`.
